title: Recognize and Avoid Carbon Monoxide Poisoning
brief: Identify carbon monoxide poisoning symptoms and ensure proper shelter ventilation.
steps: Step 1: Always check ventilation when using any open flame in enclosed spaces.
Step 2: Never sleep without turning out stove or lamp.
Step 3: Watch for symptoms: temple pressure, burning eyes, headache, pounding pulse, drowsiness, nausea.
Step 4: Look for cherry red coloring in lips, mouth, and inside eyelids - visible sign of poisoning.
Step 5: Get into fresh air immediately if any symptoms appear.
warnings: Carbon monoxide is colorless and odorless - often no warning.
Unconsciousness and death can occur without symptoms.
Any open flame can generate carbon monoxide, even in ventilated shelters.
Incomplete combustion increases carbon monoxide risk.
